page.title: 20CONTRIBUTORS
page.content: ALL RURAL COMMUNITIES RELY HEAVILY ON THE LARGE TOWNS FOR SERVICES AND EMPLOYMENT OF ALL TYPES. THERE IS NOW CONSIDERABLE CONCERN OVER THE FUTURE OF H.M.DOCKYARDS AND ASSOCIATED FACILITIES IN PLYMOUTH WHICH PROVIDE MANY JOBS.PERVERSELY FEW SUPPORT MOVES TO JOIN E.CORNWALL WITH PLYMOUTH. CORNWALL IS GENERALLY SEEN AS BEING UNIQUE AND SEPARATE FROM PLYMOUTH, DESPITE CENTRALISATION OF ESSENTIAL SERVICES.THE TELEPHONE AND HOSPITAL SERVICES RELUCTANCE TO RECOGNISE THIS SOCIAL NEED IS REGRETTED. THE INFORMATION ON THIS BLOCK HAS BEEN COLLATED BY THE DOWNDERRY AND SEATON RESIDENTS' ASSOCIATION.THERE WILL BE SOME OVERLAP WITH THE THREE ADJACENT BLOCKS WITH WHOM ALL SOCIAL EVENTS AND AMENITIES ARE SHARED. R.J.DANIEL (HON.SEC.)OCTOBER 1985
